main: ^The sun glares over you, and your ship is in pieces around you.
^You find a spot on the beach where there are dark shapes of various sizes slowly moving about.
^You cast the fishing rod into the waters several times, hoping to catch the fish you need for your potential party member.
^POC quest has been added by the previous line of dialogue (id1)
^Below is the usual choice-based quest giver (id2)
IncompleteQuest: ^this line of dialogue should play when player interacts with Amelia before completeing the quest.
^You better hurry before I change my mind.
SubmitQuest: ^Would you like to finish this quest?
^clicking on yes should remove quest with id 1 while no should do nothing
CompleteQuest: ^this line of dialogue should play when player interacts with Amelia after completeing the quest.
^After a few tries, you get the 10 fish you need.
^You return back to Amelia, who’s sitting on the sand next to the wreckage of your ship.
^Please tell me you caught some salmon.
^The fish are a lot different around here compared to home
^Is that why you were on the ship when the storms stomach rumbles again
^While I would love to keep chatting, gimme the fish, quickly!
^You hand over the fish, and Amelia hastily gobbles it all down, bones, scales and all.
^That hit the spot! Anyway, see ya—
^But the reality is I still barely know you.
^And if you can catch that many fish in a short span of time, I’m sure you’ll be able to survive fine on your own.
^And I don’t really travel in groups anyway.
^The  haunting roar of a monstrous beast echoes throughout the island. Whatever you had to say is forgotten in the moment.
^Rain begins to fall on the island.
^How long do you think it will take for us to build a new ship and get off of this island?
^I dunno - I haven’t really built a ship on my own before and—
^However long you think we need, cut that time in half.
^Change of plans, I’m coming with you.
^Now come on, we need to go.
^Amelia takes Noelle’s hand, and drags her towards the rainforests deeper in-land.
